website_summaries.verdict: With only two temperature settings this isn’t as versatile as other heat guns, but its life expectancy is longer than others in its price range.
pros: Lower temperature works well for shrink wrapping and shaping plastic
Kickstand rest and hanging attachment are appreciated
Long-lived for a bargain heat gun
cons: Power cord is somewhat stiff, making it harder to move gun around in tight spots

customer_reviews.title: Unable to operate this tool
customer_reviews.text: I just received this heat gun from Amazon. It has a plastic "guard" over the switch. I am unable to operate the heat gun with this cover over the switch. I contacted Black & Decker to see how to remove the cover. I was told that it is not removable. If you remove it, you void the warranty. They said if I am unable to operate it with the cover, return it to Amazon. I have never seen an appliance or tool with such a cover. The pictures of the tool in ads do not show such a guard over the switch. I am baffled. I guess I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage way to ship a product.
customer_reviews.text: It was shipped in its original package and was damaged on the way to me. The box is obliterated and all that i got in the box was the gun and booklet everything else gone. Tried the gun doesn't even heat up... so i ask for an exchange and now i need to come up with my own funds to buy a box to ship it back to them,... i have no problem sending it back but feel i shouldn't have to pay for shipping and a box when the person who filled the order was LAZY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: luis r.

customer_reviews.title: Has worked for hours at a time without a bit of trouble.
customer_reviews.text: I never realized how often I'd use a heat gun! I've started refreshing a 12 year old car and have used this to soften caulk, stretch vinyl and remove adhesive badges from the car. I've had this hanging in my garage, blowing on low, for several hours at a time while I'm working w/ vinyl and it keeps a stable temperature and hasn't given me a single ounce of trouble. No overheating... no blown fuses This tool is full of hot air! (sorry... I couldn't resist the pun)
customer_reviews.author: elaY

customer_reviews.title: Set off my smoke detector the first time I turned it on high
customer_reviews.text: I actually like the gun, it worked fine on low. However, when I turned it on high it started smoking like crazy, enough to set off my smoke alarm. YIKES! Amazon sent me a label to return it and I purchased a different gun.
customer_reviews.author: Renee L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Heat Gun
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this heat gun to seal my shrink wrap bags for my homemade soap. It doesn't require any "warm up time" like other devices. By the 5 second mark it is ready to use. The seller shipped fast. The heat gun was exactly as depicted and described on the seller's page. I will have no problem purchasing from this seller again should the need arise as business expands. The heat gun has both a high and low setting. The low setting was more than enough to seal my soap quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Wah

customer_reviews.title: Great value heat gun
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually shocked at how good of a heat gun this is for the price. for a long time I run an engineering lab where we had extremely high quality heat guns for heat shrinking and this time around I just needed a home use gun for getting air bubbles off the top of epoxy. This means the two to $300 guns we're just not worth it for me and so I took a shot on this one and honestly it's now my beside my soldering iron. It's doing a great job, the settings are good and the dispersion is good. For the price range it's by far the best one that I've used.
customer_reviews.author: INeedAPublicNameIGuess

customer_reviews.title: Great For Grilling Without Lighter Fluid.
customer_reviews.text: This is another great product by B&D. Well made and great product designs. The small metal stand allows the user to property store the unit while it cools or in between uses. I personally used the product today for about 15 minutes without stopping and the plastic housing and pistol grip never got hot. I used the heat gun to light charcoal for grill and the gun had the coals white hot within 10 minutes. Great time saver. Awesome product! Thanks B&D!
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: solid tool
customer_reviews.text: I did not require a heavy-duty instrument, and the price is right. Bought tool for crimping self-soldering wire connectors. It is solid feeling/weighty. The stand behind the grip allows me to place it facing straight up like a bunsen burner without sensation it may tip or move at all. Both hands free to hold wire connectors in perfect position-neatly soldered connections solidly, quickly. Job done. Have not tried for other applications.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Clawson

customer_reviews.title: Made a hard job super easy, excellent value - doesn't feel/look cheap
customer_reviews.text: I read a comment or two about flaking.. I have no clue what they're talking about because there's zero indication after some use that it'd flake (had mine on highest setting the whole time). Anyways, this is a clear winner for the "budget brand" category. I typically try to get higher end brands but this did a fantastic job. It doesn't feel cheap at all.. so yeah if you need one, this is the one to get. By the way I wasn't doing something small with this, I was actually lifting up very old linoleum.. it's heat distribution made an extremely difficult job super simple.
customer_reviews.author: I Like Turles

customer_reviews.title: Great Charcoal Lighter/Crappy Shipping
customer_reviews.text: I just received this heat gun because I really liked the way one worked that I recently ordered. This one showed up in its original pasteboard box with no protection. The box was mashed and, sure enough, the gun was damaged. What were they thinking?! The first one did show up more properly packaged with no damage. No thought went into this shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Douglass

customer_reviews.title: So far its still working...
customer_reviews.text: Heats up great on high setting. I noticed a tiny bit of smoke wafting up from nozzle after shutting it off of the HIGH setting. I don't know if this was just because it was new, i.e., new parts burning in? I recommend letting it run on LOW for a few seconds before shutoff to help cool down, which is what I did. Still works and no more smoke after three small projects.
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: One star drop due to wire on handle to help set on table to use hands free can collapse very easily if not careful? Just remember to not bump it at all when using this function- then, you'll have zero issues I suppose? Oh, very good price compared with others and I haven't had to use the higher position as of yet. Heat works great from the lower of the two settings. Heat gun cools down quickly which is also very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Keoki

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: Received item as described. Looks exactly like the picture. I haven't used it yet. I purchased this to seal shrink wrap. I will make an update on how it goes. My only disappointment is the package wasn't secured. It came opened.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. B

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine for Heat-Shrink Electrical Fittings and Removing Backs of Phones
customer_reviews.text: I suppose there are other things one could do with a heat gun, but the only things I use it for are shrinking heat-shrink tubing and electrical fittings, or removing the backs of phones. It does both very nicely on the lower setting. I haven't had occasion to use the higher setting, but I imagine it's... hotter than the low setting. In any case, it's supposed to blow hot air, and it does in fact blow hot air, so I'm giving it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Geek On The Hill

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and durable
customer_reviews.text: This thing gets volcano hot..!! I'm not surprised that Black and Decker found a way to build something as cheap feeling as this, and have it outperform the expensive brands.. Super satisfied with my purchase....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small amount of white smoke is normal
customer_reviews.text: Many reviews are mentioning that after being on high and turning off a small amount of white smoke comes out. This is normal behavior for cheaply made heat guns. To cut costs they don't wash off the oil from metal parts in the gun, and the white smoke is just that oil residue burning off. They still get -1 star for that, but it is normal behavior and will go away with use. As long as its not blue or black smoke, you're fine. (if you can't tell by colour, burning electronics or plastic, respectively, both have distinctive smells)
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Turn up the heat!
customer_reviews.text: This product works awesome for heating up heat shrink, melting and forming plastic, and just turning up the heat! When I first saw the name "black and decker", it turned me a little bit off. However, since I don't use a heat gun on a daily basis, I decided to give it a try. I am so glad that I did. This has exceeded my expectations and I find myself using it a lot more often with my hobbies. Just the other day, I vinyl wrapped a part of my car using this product. My Wife also likes this product because she can have her hair dryer back.
customer_reviews.author: DaveTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Dual Settings Multi Uses From The Garage To Crafts
customer_reviews.text: I love the dual settings on this heat gun. I can use it to crafts and in the garage. It has a wire brace to keep the hot end off of surfaces and you can also hang it on a hook with it. The cord is heavy duty. I've used it many times since I've had it. I would definitely buy this product again if I had to do it over.
customer_reviews.author: QuiltergirlTop Contributor: Quilting

customer_reviews.title: Full of hot air! (In a good way)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my pour painting and it works great. I love the fact that there’s two heat settings. It’s very well made and it’s a purchase I’m glad I made.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Landfather

customer_reviews.title: Great Heat Gun
customer_reviews.text: Good Brand and reliable product so far so good no issues. I use it for small electrical and perform wonderfully. I love the back end has the ability to stand upright on its own with no additional supports needed thanks to the flared out body. Feels and works as good as some Werner heat guns I have had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: A good heat gun
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different heat guns. Mostly in screen printing but, some paint stripping. Black & Decker has made a good simple to use heat gun. Works like any I have used. Primo for shrink tubing or hobby & crafts use. Gtreat for stripping chores. Will cure inks textiles.
customer_reviews.author: Strictlin

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap, hot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use to heat and dry resin and to mold foam for table top games. It gets plenty hot and gets hot fast. Black and Decker gets a pass on this one. I've only used it for a couple hours total, but it comes on every time and gets as hot as you'd want to use for craft projects. Probably not "professional grade," but absolutely worth its cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Splintalol

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact it shuts off when you shut it off. So easy to use. I use it to get air bubbles out of resin and to heat up my Wood U Bend pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D Jones

customer_reviews.title: A nice machine!
customer_reviews.text: The gun is easy to hold and the heat is awesome! I like the two heat ranges. The only thing I did not like as much was the flexible plastic water/dust guard over the switch. I found it made the switch difficult to operate. I removered the cover with a razor knife. The heat gun works very well now.
customer_reviews.author: David Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Works well, heats up fast
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure I'm not the first one to think the plastic cover over the switch is removable, but let me reiterate what I've learned: DO NOT REMOVE THE PLASTIC COVER. I'm not exactly sure the purpose of it being there, but it's a non-issue for me. The gun warms up and gets to temperature quick and doesn't get ridiculously hot, which was perfect since I was using it for vinyl wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Zandro De Bartolome

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need for heat shrink electrical insulation.
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought one of these things 20 years ago! I've been using a cigarette lighter to heat shrink electrical insulation on outdoor connections like in my boat, trailer, etc for years. Usually outside in a force 5 gale. Anyway, I had to lengthen the pigtail on my camper, and I had to make the electrical connections during a light rain and 25 knot winds. This sucker worked. If I had had to do with the cig lighter I would have been out of luck because no way would it have stayed lit.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Askew

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: Liked the high/low option. Used it to shrink wire connectors. Enjoyed the job by working with this. Great product for the price
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heat gun
customer_reviews.text: Heats really fast and gets very hot, even on low. Smoked a little after the first use but the instructions point out that it will smoke until the oil residue from manufacturing burns off the heating element. No more smoke and it does just what I wanted at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: H. Potter

customer_reviews.title: It fixed the job I needed it to
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a heat gun before so don't have any other reference than the job this one did. I used it to heat and pull up 18 inch vinyl floor squares that would not come up. They all pulled right up within a few seconds of the heat applied. I will mention the heat blew well and was really hot.
customer_reviews.author: bobwjr

customer_reviews.title: Is working well in occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: I only use this about twice a month for heat shrink, or decal removal. It works, though I cant say that it heats better or worse than a cheapo I had before, for 10 years. The handle is comfortable, trigger cover is stiff. The folding wire stand is a nice feature for cooldown, that my cheapo didnt have.
customer_reviews.author: D Lukes

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works just as you would expect a heat gun to work. Low setting is equivalent to the high setting in a hair dryer and works great for vinyl. High setting is about 1000 degrees Fahrenheit. Yes there is a trigger guard and no it is not nearly as annoying as any reviews I’ve read. It DOES NOT impede the function of the trigger button.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not dissapointed!
customer_reviews.text: I'm thankful I sent a little bit more money for this heat gun. I used it to strip paint off of 2 wooden doors. I first read some reviews of other heating guns and decided to go with a brand I trusted and thankful I did!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: It really does the job I would buy this again! I’m still using mine it’s been 4 years and stilll working great!
customer_reviews.author: carlos lopez

customer_reviews.title: 🎃💀GOT FOR CORPSING SKELTONS🎃
customer_reviews.text: ..works great, used mostly on low, plenty hot.. Using on a heavy duty cord.. Not too heavy, though substantial.. I like that you can sit it on its end in between.. Good price.. 🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈
customer_reviews.author: 🐆😺MeoW😸🐆

customer_reviews.title: Puts out some serious heat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with heat shrink tubing and now the new heat shrink electrical connectors. Beats the hell out of using propane grill starters or cigarette lighters. Works like a charm. Had to replace my state inspection sticker lately and used it to heat up the sticker for easy removal. Be careful though, this heat gun puts out some serious heat in the high mode.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Culpepper

customer_reviews.title: Great for Shrink Wrapping Use and other stuff too.
customer_reviews.text: I was using a heavy Master heat gun for many years for simple shrink wrapping of small items. It started to die and I decided after reading the reviews to try this one. It is soooo much better for shrink wrap then the pro Master model I had. Faster, heats up enough to shrink in the lower setting and I don't burn my fingers. Quiet too the other one was very noisy and light. Love it, would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lenrapp

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help with a new auto stereo install (heat shrink tubing over wire splices) and the Hi/Lo settings worked great for matching the heat to the size of the piece I was working on. Cheaper units on the market but this is a name brand I'm familiar with and many of those off-brands are of questionable quality... Recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Hot hot hot
customer_reviews.text: I have used this strictly for lighting the pellets in my smoker tube and it does an amazing job at that. I have several black and decker products and this one has so far met my expectations and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Zacc Kernper

customer_reviews.title: Good for small projects and light use.
customer_reviews.text: You know you’re not getting high end with B&D, but as long as you use this periodically for small jobs, it does it’s job well. I used it to remove adhesive residue off of my motorcycle fender and it didn’t bubble the paint or discolor it.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie R. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Great for pushing pigement resin around
customer_reviews.text: I got this for an art project with epoxy resin and pigment. It worked great to push and mix the pigments around. Two settings, not too strong but will move the resin around with ease. Affordable so great for a hobby or school art project
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Great item at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I have now used this heat gun twice and it works very well. There is a metal stand that you can fold out so you can prop it up to cool off. Working with 3M vinyl and this sure beats using a hair drier. For the price, it is good to have when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Hdwrguy

customer_reviews.title: New To Using Heat Gun
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a heat gun before. I started making homemade soaps and it was suggested I shrink wrap my soap. Was a told I needed a heat gun so I bought this one. It's easy to use and does the job. Did I mention I will be 70 the end of the month. Just shows you are never to old to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Sondra K. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Gets the Job Done`
customer_reviews.text: It turns on, it heats up and it works. Not much else to say about it. I just use it for shrink wrap on electrical connections and occasionally softening plastic and PVC for DIY projects so my use is light.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Works Great! Bye Bye hair dryer!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing value! Instead of using my wife's hair dryer again I just broke down and got it. So far I've used it for soft PVC piping and electrical heat shrink tubing and it works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Jerome

customer_reviews.title: If you have a strong thumb, you can get past the safety plastic..
customer_reviews.text: why in God's name did they put plastic over the trigger? this is the dumbest decision ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: As I plug it in it start to smoke and nothing works...Worst purchase i have ever made in my life!!! Even a toy heat gun would BE BETTER than this junk!!! DO NOT BUY!!!!!!! Got it broken up.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Heat Gun
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a Christmas gift. It was shipped in original package with all details of what was inside and just a label slapped on it. So much for surprise at Christmas. The package has a hole in it about the size of a dime. I am just hoping it is in good working order as it will not be opened until Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: M.  Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good value, does the job
customer_reviews.text: Got this to remove some reflectors from my motorcycle. I used the low setting for 2.5-3 minutes and they slide right off! Also used it to take some heavy scratches out of some plastic. Easy-peasy!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: NOT A BLOW DRYER
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use , took the hair right off the cat . Works well on squirrels as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Paul Fugitt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I bought to use on my battery wraps for my vape batteries. I will also use it for other stuff, but mainly that. It works perfect for what I need. Gets hot enough to put the wrap on even, but not hot enough to melt it. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to rewrap batteries, or just needs a heat gun in general. Very durable!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur W.

customer_reviews.title: Good Budget Heat gun
customer_reviews.text: Nothing more you need for an around the house or hobby heat gun. Shrinks connectors; removes labels, paint, jar lids, etc everything the pros do. Might not hold up if you are a pro.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Brill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. The breeze it creates is minor (so not good for embossing powders, but insignificant for most applications). Two heat settings is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great for the house and works
customer_reviews.text: I am a makita guy but it's way overpriced. I needed a heat gun and for like 15 bucks this works great. You dont need anything more than this unless you are a professional.
customer_reviews.author: David Whang

customer_reviews.title: HOT
customer_reviews.text: Great heat gun at a reasonable price. Smoked a little bit the first time but I think that was because of the new coils and breaking in. Has worked great ever since!
customer_reviews.author: Claybuster

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this for smoothing my candles. It was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hayward

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! Used this to soften up and remove epoxy from inside the hull on a Yamaha Waverunner. Also was very useful for removing the traction mats and glue from the deck. No issues!
customer_reviews.author: JosephN

customer_reviews.title: Slow shipping. Terrible, nonexistent packaging. Product itself good.
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine. Works well other than having to burn off the manufacturing residue when first operated. Turn it on initially outside and let it run awhile before using inside. It amazingly survived the journey in its shelf packaging. Box was mangled. Shipping was achingly slow and then got lost for awhile. Amazon shipping if you are not a prime member is abhorrent.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat it for the price. The box was open when I received it so I was a little skeptical about that, seems a little odd. The gun works how it should, but kind of smells at first. I don't know if the smell will go away or not, but for the price I guess I can't complain. The duel temp is nice. It gets hot REAL quick.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: I've used a few times, but works great!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this for long and only used it a few times. Works just as expected! Great value
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: One tool...so many uses
customer_reviews.text: I've used this; to warm up pex tubing to make it easier for bending, to remove ice from a sliding door track, for heat shrink, to remove paint on a wall...the list goes on. Only complaint would be the cover over the switch makes it a bit hard to click on/off when I have my work gloves on but that is not enough of an issue to dock it a star. It gets plenty hot so be careful what you point it at. I always wear leather gloves when using it to prevent burns from the tip or if I'm holding small parts in front of it. Definitely a good buy
customer_reviews.author: Dave & Joy

customer_reviews.title: Great value, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a DIY project for my son's Xterra. You heat up the faded grey plastic to restore the black finish. It worked excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Get Outside

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this purchase! Works just as described.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Very happy with this purchase. Have used it pretty much constantly as I am stripping 5 large windows on an 1840's shotgun house.For the price its pretty incredible considering I went through $20 worth of strong paint stripper that took forever, was really messy and didnt work too well at all. Totally recommend this heat gun!
customer_reviews.author: F George

customer_reviews.title: Works. Sometimes smokes.
customer_reviews.text: It works... mostly. Sometimes it smokes and I need to unplug it. Usually it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: A Busch

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit, works well.
customer_reviews.text: On unboxing, found a new permanent looking switch protector. Clear flexible heavy duty plastic. Looks permanent. Not mentioned in the booklet or seen in the pictures. Comments?
customer_reviews.author: Christie B. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Good heat gun at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Works just as designed. Here's a hint if you are new to heat guns, as I was. Don't grab the metal end of the heat gun after you turn it off. It's still VERY hot and it will burn you down to blisters. And that hurts a lot.
customer_reviews.author: clm

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Heat gun at a rally good price.
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice Heat gun at a really good price. Rarely is low price paired with good quality. In this case it is.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Cordell

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I started to use in my bathroom and fire alarm went off ugh freaked out this does the trick but be careful
customer_reviews.author: Jay A. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great balance of Heat and Air.
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT. The Dual Heat Feature is a MUST. Used this to repair warped/damaged body-work on my ATV's HDPE Fender Assemblies, and it worked perfectly. Delivers plenty Heat with the right amount of Air for tricky repairs.
customer_reviews.author: Artmon

customer_reviews.title: Super Hot super fast.
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase my whole garage wall is black and decker.
customer_reviews.author: Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Powerful dual temp heat gun - great for most projects!
customer_reviews.text: I worked with a B&D heat gun in the past and was using it to dry glass wine bottles after acid etching (a bit of a longer process) and it burned out the motor. In general though, I like the dual heat option and the durability of the item. I guess you just need to be cautious around the length of time (with any heat gun) that you are using it. I'm now using the gun for my encaustic painting work and it is perfect for this process.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Just right for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: Used it to melt the tape that secored glass back cover on Samsung Note 5 in order to replace the internal battery. Worked perfectly, did not damage the cover or components underneath
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: Great for embossing
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quickly. I can sure it upright cause it's got a kick stand feature. Works great for embossing.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the sole purpose of removing old license plate registration decals. I was able to peel it off in 15-30 seconds!
customer_reviews.author: DAVID

customer_reviews.title: Is what it is; does what it does
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I just wish it had attachments. Has two intensities.
customer_reviews.author: Just Kate

customer_reviews.title: Handy and works great
customer_reviews.text: This is so handy for so many home projects. Esp use for making pvc toys for my parrots.
customer_reviews.author: CaroleSue

customer_reviews.title: Good heat gun for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Able to produce enough heat to break loose red loctite in a short period of time without using a torch. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, multi purpose heat gun
customer_reviews.text: I have used a hobby heat gun, shop paint stripper, and propane torch for different purposes for many years. I purchased this one as a replacement and ended up using it for many projects. Exceptional value.
customer_reviews.author: RDL

customer_reviews.title: great tool for good price
customer_reviews.text: works like a charm if you are doing more intricate work on non heat resistant wiring just go easy with it and get the head adapters to concentrate the heat
customer_reviews.author: corbin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This low cost heat gun did a great job of removing ugly stripes and logos from my 13 year old RV. Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: BCutter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this tool is well made at an affordable price
customer_reviews.author: Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good heatgun
customer_reviews.text: Used this to bend some PETG tubing for a computer water loop. It's great for that purpose. Just set it on low and leave it on the stand facing up.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Holt

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I use it for resin art projects.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Very resistente!
customer_reviews.text: Very strong! You can put all your tint with this tool! Very nice
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo

customer_reviews.title: Nice deal for a hard-working heat gun.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to dry out the headlight enclosure from a Ford Focus.It ran consistently for 30 minutes with no problems at all.It made me confident that it'll be working for me for times to come.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not very hot
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! First remove Paint or wallpaper. It doesn't get very hot.
customer_reviews.author: to

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Works great at a medium to high temp! Great for swirling inks if you make tumblers!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Two temp settings but works really well, does not feel flimsy or cheap. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cheap and works great
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to do everything from heat shrink tubing to bending PVC pipes
customer_reviews.author: Duane Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Recommended- as described
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for heating up a frozen lock. Served the purpose it was purchased for. And a nice addition to my tool stash.
customer_reviews.author: Robert  M Stober

customer_reviews.title: Great for small electrical work
customer_reviews.text: Great for small electrical work. Used it twice so far for shrink tube wiring car stereos. For people that say it burns up...use the metal clip on the handle. When you set it down after use you need to lay it vertical to cool properly (with the nose of the gun pointing up. Otherwise it does not properly vent and will of course burn up and fail.
customer_reviews.author: Prosite

customer_reviews.title: HOT
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed, this thing gets HOT even on low. It's a bit of overkill for what I got it for (heat shrinking mostly) but I'm sure it will have other uses as well. The switch has a rubber cover over it to prevent I assume moisture from getting into the switch. It has a stand on the handle allowing it to be placed so that it is aimed directly up, useful if you need both hands to hold something.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Heats up great!
customer_reviews.text: Gets hot, that's about it. Handle remains cool so hand is safe.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Needs more blow
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect if u don’t want to over heat ur stuff
customer_reviews.author: ALL lives matter

customer_reviews.title: it's just ok
customer_reviews.text: ehhh...it's all right. I wish the nozzle was longer for tough get-to spots. I can tell it is getting hot but really didn't melt household paint all too well. I also wish it had a longer cord but my star rating was not effected by this.
customer_reviews.author: ebielli

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to help scrap up three layers of linoleum off my master bathroom floor. It was easy to use and did a great job! I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon mitchell

customer_reviews.title: And don't just leave it on a like a hair dryer
customer_reviews.text: This works well for heat stripping of paint . But you have to be careful, utterly careful if you were going to use it on anything other than masonry. Also be sure not to overload the circuits in a house. And don't just leave it on a like a hair dryer, because on high it's 1,000 degrees hot.
customer_reviews.author: Darling Clementine

customer_reviews.title: EASY AND SMALL
customer_reviews.text: IT WORKS, THE FAN IS A LITTLE WEAK BUT IT GETS THE JOB DONE JUST FINE
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: It already arrived, I just need to verify the quality, later I will update the Review
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Peralta

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: used this item to apply graphics on my dirtbike. worked great for me using only the low setting.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: and this is perfect. It really puts out heat
customer_reviews.text: I need to shrink wrap all my products before they hit the shelves, and this is perfect. It really puts out heat. I didn't have any odor or smoke when starting it up. The price is reasonable and it meets the standards of other Black & Decker products. Plus, it is much faster than using a hair dryer.
customer_reviews.author: PlantSerums

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER Heat Gun, Dual Temperature (HG1300)
product_meta.description:
Heat gun. Two heat settings. Lightweight compact unit. 1375 watt. 2 year warranty. 500° F to 1,000° F. 4,600 BTU. Length: 9.37. Width: 9.62. Height: 3

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Black & Decker HG1300 Dual Temperature Heat Gun has 2 temperature settings (750 Degrees and 1000 Degrees) for a variety of applications. It can be used for stripping paint and varnish, loosening rusted nuts and bolts, thaw frozen pipes, or quick dry most anything. It has a built-in stand for easy cool down and a lightweight and compact design for ease of use and handling.
feature_bullets: 2 temperature settings (750 Degrees and 1000 Degrees) for a variety of applications
Built-in stand for easy cool down
Lightweight and compact design for ease of use and handling
2 temperature settings (750 Degrees and 1000 Degrees) for a variety of applications

Lightweight and compact design for ease of use and handling
Ideal for stripping paint, loosening rusted bolt and my other applications
